data.title: Lots of surprises inside
data.text: Art, history, politics, architecture are all highlights.  Two cafes and a gift shop.   Free tours including the senate and house and governor's office.   Interesting historical facts.  Very unusual architecture points.

data.title: Surprise visit
data.text: We visited the Ohio State House when my son and daughter-in-law were visiting from NYC. We wanted something to do that would be interesting to them and this seemed like a plausible choice. We had a good time comparing the Ohio State House to the museums in NYC. It isn’t the MET, but hey it’s in Columbus and our history buff family enjoyed learning about Ohio’s history. My daughter-in-law who is a docent at MET thought rather highly of our local museum. That surprised me.

data.title: Read the Wall
data.text: The best part of this stop is to read the letters from soldiers. It should make you think and be thankful for those that serve. There is a touching letter which reminds you that the Holocaust was real.

data.title: Interesting but not a memorable tour
data.text: Audio tours available. We decided to tour with a guide. Not an enthusiastic experience from our guide. Basically only time there was excitement in her voice was talking about Lincoln. We read more about the history after we left. A plain looking capitol building.

data.title: Great historical visit
data.text: I went there about 10 years ago with my daughter's class.  It is very interesting and the rotunda is fantastic.

data.title: Worth a Visit!
data.text: Impressive architectural masterpiece in downtown Columbus.   The Statehouse combines the old Statehouse with a newer wing.  Lots of hidden treasures within so explore away and take in some of Ohio's rich history.

data.title: A History Lover's Dream!
data.text: This attraction deserves to be on the "must-see" list of every visitor to Columbus. We have been to numerous state houses across the country, and Ohio ranks among the best we have seen. As other reviewers have said, it is beautifully maintained. I will add to that and say that it is absolutely loaded with history. Abraham Lincoln himself visited the building more than once! Do not miss the free guided tour, which is excellent. The guide explains many details of the building's architecture and describes the artwork (both paintings and sculptures), which depicts  important moments in the history of the state of Ohio. There is a nice museum/education center on the lower floor, and the gift shop is very nice. You will learn a lot here and come away with pride in the state of Ohio!

data.title: A historic building well maintained
data.text: The Statehouse is beautifully maintained and worth a visit if only to find out why the capital structure itself is truncated.

data.title: The People's House
data.text:
From the sculptures, cannon, and memorials outside on the grounds, to the Great Seal of Ohio high atop the cupola, to the museum in the bowels, the People's House is magnificent!
Take some time to see this wonderful seat of Ohio government. Take time to see Ohio's senate and house in action. Take time to eat in the newish Graze Seasonal Market & Grill. No matter what time of year you visit, you will be pleased.

data.title: Dowtown Columbus
data.text: Don't miss the Statehouse. Beautiful old building with lots of history. Free guided tours are available.

data.title: Very impressive.
data.text: So nice to see the inside of Ohio government.  Our tour guide was excellent and added a wealth of knowledge and historical information.

data.title: Beautiful Capitol
data.text: Both inside and out you can experience the history of our state and our country. The grounds are beautifully manicured. Bronze memorials grace the grounds on every corner. A must see are the walls with letters from war.

data.title: The Capital!
data.text: This is a very beautiful and interesting building for the seat of Ohio State government. There is a museum in the building which should be seen and which is going to take some time. There are also other exhibits to see and make sure you see and read all of the information interesting information. Then make sure you go on a guided tour, this is worth it and is free! Can't go wrong! The tour guide was most interesting with facts and lore about the building. She was very knowledgeable and experienced. This was worth the trip and I became more wise about the history of Ohio.

data.title: Beautiful statehouse
data.text: Great, traditional style state house.  Historical museum in the basement along with a gift shop and document display

data.title: Excellent place for an educational learning experience. Must see in Columbus, Ohio!
data.text: Take the tour, it is free and the docents  are very knowledgeable. It is a great place to learn about the history of Ohio and the U.S.. Parking is easy, and there are so many other places to see in downtown !

data.title: Plan 1.5 hrs for tour
data.text: This is not the best state house I've been but it's still one of the bets ones. The tour runs on weekend and I would highly recommend it.

data.title: Art Appreciation and History in One Stop
data.text: OH Statehouse - architecturally fits the definition of "Greek Revival" - no doubt! Tours are available free of charge and WELL worth the visit. The Ohio Veteran's Plaza has two curved limestone walls with personal letters sent to families and loved ones from those serving since WWII (powerful and very moving!) The stained glass art, the museum, and the rotunda are picture-worthy! Items in the gift shop are modestly priced and many by local artisans.

data.title: Awesome self guided or guided tour!
data.text: I have been here a couple times now and even brought my 8 year old son once.  The gift shop is really nice and sells a wide variety of Ohio memorabilia.  If you love history, then you will love this tour.  I found out many fascinating facts and was really intrigued about everything that has happened here in Columbus and Ohio.  Being a Ohio resident, I will give a few tips.  1.) park in the underground parking garage this way you are directly connected to the Statehouse.  2.) After the tour is done, go see some more of Columbus!  3.) Take the free Cbus that rotates up and down High St. and Front St.  It'll eventually take you back to the statehouse. 4) Check out the Columbus Commons not too far from the Statehouse, North Market, Short North, Arena District and the Brewery District.  Enjoy!

data.title: Great Local History Lesson
data.text: If you haven't brought your family to visit the statehouse, you are missing out! The architecture is wonderful, including the wonderful historical artwork adorning the walls. There is a small historical museum and tours are given periodically. You can even arrange a special time for a larger group. They provide excellent Ohio State history that every resident should know. The gift shop offers local Ohio made products and maps as well as local attraction information. This is also a wonderful venue for weddings and business parties offering gorgeous picturesque settings and quite a few set-up/location options! I highly recommend a visit or to plan your next event at this location.

data.title: Simple State House
data.text: The State house is beautiful in its simplicity.  The grounds are beautiful with several moving monuments. Easy access on weekend.
